contentrichtext.text: {{italic title}} {{Taxobox | name = ''Laemanctus'' | image = Laemanctus longipes (1).jpg | image_size = 240px | image_caption = ''Laemanctus longipes'', <br>eastern casquehead iguana | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordate|Chordata]] | subphylum = [[Vertebrata]] | classis = [[Reptilia]] | ordo = [[Squamata]] | subordo = [[Sauria]] | familia = [[Corytophanidae]] | genus = '''''Laemanctus''''' | genus_authority = [[Arend Friedrich August Wiegmann|Wiegmann]], 1834 | subdivision_ranks = Species | subdivision = ''[[Laemanctus longipes]]''<br> ''[[Laemanctus serratus]]'' }} '''''Laemanctus''''' is a [[genus]] of [[corytophanidae|corytophanid]] [[lizard]]s, commonly referred to as '''conehead lizards''' or '''casquehead iguanas''', which are [[Endemism|endemic]] to [[Central America]].<ref>[[:fr:Coleman Jett Goin|Goin, C.J.]]; O.B. Goin; G.R. Zug. 1978. ''Introduction to Herpetology, Third Edition''. W.H. Freeman. San Francisco. xi + 378 pp. ISBN 0-7167-0020-4. (''Laemanctus'', p. 291.)</ref> ==Description== [[Tympanum (anatomy)|Tympanum]] distinct. Plane of top of head sloping forward, occipital region raised and extending beyond [[occiput]]. Body laterally compressed, covered with imbricate [[keeled scales]]. A strong transverse [[gular]] fold present. Gular pouch absent. Limbs very long, infradigital [[Lamella (anatomy)|lamellae]] with a median tubercle-like keel. [[Femoral pores]] absent. Tail very long, round in cross section. Lateral teeth tricuspid, [[Pterygoid bone|pterygoid]] teeth present. [[Clavicle]] loop-shaped [[proximal]]ly. [[Sternum|Sternal]] fontanelle absent. [[Gastralium|Abdominal ribs]] absent.<ref>[[George Albert Boulenger|Boulenger, G.A.]] 1885. ''Catalogue of the Lizards in the British Museum (Natural History). Second Edition. Volume II. Iguanidæ...'' Trustees of the British Museum (Natural History). (Taylor and Francis, Printers.) London. xiii + 497 pp. + Plates I.- XXIV. (Genus ''Læmanctus'', p. 104.)</ref> ==Species== The genus consists of two recognized [[species]] with six [[subspecies]], including the [[nominotypical subspecies]]:<ref>The Reptile Database. www.reptile-database.org.</ref> *''[[Laemanctus longipes]]'' <small>[[Arend Friedrich August Wiegmann|Wiegmann]], 1834</small> - eastern casquehead iguana :*''[[Laemanctus longipes deborrei]]'' <small>[[George Albert Boulenger|Boulenger]], 1877</small> :*''[[Laemanctus longipes longipes]]'' <small>Wiegmann, 1834</small> :*''[[Laemanctus longipes waltersi]]'' <small>[[Karl Patterson Schmidt|Schmidt]], 1933</small> *''[[Laemanctus serratus]]'' <small>[[Edward Drinker Cope|Cope]], 1864</small> - serrated casquehead iguana :*''[[Laemanctus serratus alticoronatus]]'' <small>Cope, 1866</small> :*''[[Laemanctus serratus mccoyi]]'' <small>[[Gonzalo Pérez Higareda|Pérez-Higareda]] & [[Richard Carl Vogt|Vogt]], 1985</small> :*''[[Laemanctus serratus serratus]]'' <small>Cope, 1864</small> ==References== {{Reflist}} ==Further reading== * McCoy, C.J. 1968. A review of the genus ''Laemanctus'' (Reptilia, Iguanidae). ''Copeia'' '''1968''' (4): 665-678. *[[Arend Friedrich August Wiegmann|Wiegmann, A.F.A.]] 1834. ''Herpetologica Mexicana, seu Descriptio Amphibiorum Novae Hispaniae, quae Itineribus Comitis de Sack, Ferdinandi Deppe et Chr. Guil. Schiede in Museum Berolinense Pervenerunt. Pars Prima, Saurorum Species Amplectens. Adiecto Systematis Saurorum Prodromo, Additisque Multis in hunc Amphibiorum Ordinem Observationibus.''C.G. Lüderitz. Berlin. vi + 54 pp. + Plates I.- X. (Genus ''Laemanctus'', pp. 45-46.) [[Category:Corytophanids]] {{Lizard-stub}}
